title: Hyundai Ioniq 5
content:
{{Short description|2021 battery electric car}} {{Distinguish|Hyundai Ioniq|Maxus G50#Maxus EUNIQ 5 {{!}} Maxus EUNIQ 5}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2022}} {{Infobox automobile | name = Hyundai Ioniq 5 (NE) | image = Hyundai Ioniq 5 Uniq-Paket – f 27062021.jpg | manufacturer = [[Hyundai Motor Company|Hyundai]] | production = March 2021 – present | model_years = 2022–present (North America) | assembly = {{Unbulleted list | South Korea: [[Ulsan]] ([[Hyundai Ulsan Plant|Ulsan Plant 1]]){{Cite web|last=서울경제|date=30 March 2021|title='아이오닉5·코나' 현대차 울산1공장 4월 7~14일부터 생산 중단|url=https://www.sedaily.com/NewsView/22K0D55DBR/GD0101|access-date=15 August 2021|website=서울경제|language=ko|archive-date=15 August 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210815041316/https://www.sedaily.com/NewsView/22K0D55DBR/GD0101|url-status=live}} | Indonesia: [[Cikarang|Cikarang, West Java]] ([[Hyundai Motor Manufacturing Indonesia|HMMI]]){{Cite web |title=Hyundai Perkuat Inovasinya di Indonesia Melalui Peresmian Pabrik Pertama di Asia Tenggara |url=https://www.hyundai.com/id/id/hyundai-story/news.1150.L |access-date=18 March 2022 |website=Hyundai Motors |language=id}} | Singapore: [[Jurong]] ([[List of Hyundai Motor Company manufacturing facilities#Hyundai Motor Group Innovation Center in Singapore|HMGICS]]){{Cite web |title=IONIQ 5 First 100 {{!}} HMGICS |url=https://www.hyundai.com/sg/charity-auction |access-date=2023-01-11 |website=Hyundai Motor Group Innovation Center in Singapore (HMGICS) |language=en}} | India: [[Chennai]] ([[Hyundai Motor India|HMIL]]){{Cite web |title=Auto Expo 2023: Hyundai Ioniq 5 EV launched at Rs 44.95 lakh |url=https://www.autocarindia.com/car-news/auto-expo-2023-hyundai-ioniq-5-ev-launched-at-rs-4495-lakh-426904 |access-date=2023-01-11 |website=Autocar India}} }} | designer = Lee Ji-hyeon{{Cite web|title=DM/213 429|url=https://www3.wipo.int/designdb/hague/en/showData.jsp?SOURCE=HAGUE&KEY=D213429|publisher=[[WIPO]]}} | class = [[Compact crossover SUV]]{{cite web|url=https://www.caranddriver.com/hyundai/ioniq-5|title=2023 Hyundai Ioniq 5|publisher=Car and Driver|access-date=2022-12-21}} | body_style = 5-door [[SUV]] | layout = {{Unbulleted list | [[Rear-motor, rear-wheel-drive]] | [[Dual-motor, all-wheel-drive]] }} | platform = [[Hyundai E-GMP]] | related = {{Unbulleted list | [[Hyundai Ioniq 6]] | [[Kia EV6]] | [[Genesis GV60]] }} | motor = EM07/EM17 [[permanent magnet synchronous motor]] | battery = 58–77.4{{nbsp}}kWh [[Lithium nickel manganese cobalt oxides|nickel-cobalt-manganese lithium]]{{Cite web|title=I Drove The 800-Volt Hyundai Ioniq 5, The First Car On The 'Revolutionary' E-GMP Platform. It's Fantastic|url=https://jalopnik.com/i-drove-the-800-volt-hyundai-ioniq-5-the-first-car-on-1848191542|language=en}} | electric_range = Up to {{cvt|481|km|mi|0}} | charging = {{ubl | '''[[Alternating current|AC]]:''' | 11 kW | '''[[Direct current|DC]]:''' | 220 kW at 800 V charging stations | '''[[Reverse charging]] ({{abbr|V2L|Vehicle-To-Load}}):''' | Up to 3.6 kW{{cite web |url=https://www.hyundaiusa.com/us/en/vehicles/ioniq-5 |title=Hyundai IONIQ 5 Features |work=Charging |publisher=[[Hyundai Motor Group|Hyundai]] |url-status=live |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20221017012637/https://www.hyundai.com/eu/models/ioniq5/features.html |archivedate=2022-10-16 |accessdate=2022-10-17 }} }} | wheelbase = {{cvt|3000|mm|in|1}} | length = {{cvt|4635|mm|in|1}} | width = {{cvt|1890|mm|in|1}} | height = {{cvt|1605|mm|in|1}} | weight = {{Unbulleted list | {{cvt|1830|-|1950|kg|0}} (58{{nbsp}}kWh) | {{cvt|1910|-|2100|kg|0}} (72.6{{nbsp}}kWh) | {{cvt|4200|-|4662|lb|kg|order=flip|0}} (77.4{{nbsp}}kWh) }} }} The '''Hyundai Ioniq 5''' ({{lang-ko|현대 아이오닉 5}}) is a [[Battery electric vehicle|battery electric]] [[compact crossover SUV]] produced by [[Hyundai Motor Company|Hyundai]] since 2021. It is the first product to be marketed under the electric cars-focused [[Ioniq]] sub-brand, and the first model developed on the [[Hyundai Electric Global Modular Platform|Hyundai Electric Global Modular Platform (E-GMP)]].{{cite news |author1=Joey Capparella |title=2022 Hyundai Ioniq 5 Production EV Previewed before February Reveal |url=https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a35196654/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-preview/ |access-date=15 January 2021 |date=13 January 2021 |archive-date=29 March 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210329110807/https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a35196654/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-preview/ |url-status=live }} == Overview == The Ioniq 5 was revealed globally on 23 February 2021.{{Cite web |title=2022 Hyundai Ioniq 5 Revealed With Concept Look, Ultra-Fast Charging |url=https://www.motor1.com/news/489888/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-reveal/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210223070351/https://www.motor1.com/news/489888/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-reveal/ |archive-date=23 February 2021 |access-date=23 February 2021 |website=Motor1.com |language=en}} Its design was previewed by the Hyundai 45 EV Concept which was presented at the [[International Motor Show Germany#2019|Frankfurt Motor Show]] in September 2019. Both the concept car and the production version are inspired by the original [[Hyundai Pony]],{{Cite web|last=Meiners|first=Jens|date=12 April 2021|title=1970s Hyundai Pony Restored with EV Powertrain, Ultra-Cool Interior|url=https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a36087857/hyundai-pony-ev-revealed/|access-date=2 July 2021|website=Car and Driver|language=en-US|archive-date=17 April 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210417052442/https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a36087857/hyundai-pony-ev-revealed/|url-status=live}} and features the Parametric Pixel design that is applied to the headlights, tail lights, and wheels. The vehicle's clamshell hood spans the entire width to make a sleek look with the 20-inch aerodynamic wheels.{{Cite news|title=미래형 전기차 '아이오닉 5' 이미지 첫 공개… "살짝 설렜어 난"|work=서울신문|url=https://www.seoul.co.kr/news/newsView.php?id=20210113500147&wlog_tag3=naver|url-status=live|access-date=13 January 2021|archive-date=28 January 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210128004911/https://www.seoul.co.kr/news/newsView.php?id=20210113500147&wlog_tag3=naver}} The "45" describes both the 45th anniversary of the Pony coupe and the 45-degree angles prominent on the sides of the concept.{{cite news |author=Priddle, Alisa |date=10 September 2019 |title=Remember the Hyundai Pony? EV Concept Honors Brand's First Car in Frankfurt |work=Motor Trend |url=https://www.motortrend.com/news/hyundai-pony-45-ev-concept-electric-compact-frankfurt-first-look/ |access-date=22 December 2021}} At the time, Hyundai called the design language "sensuous sportiness" and described the front and rear lights as carrying a "kinetic cube" theme.{{cite news |author=Halvorson, Bengt |date=11 September 2019 |title=Hyundai hatches an electric future with retro 45 EV concept |work=Green Car Reports |url=https://www.greencarreports.com/news/1124993_hyundai-hatches-an-electric-future-with-retro-45-ev-concept |access-date=22 December 2021}} The Ioniq 5 was developed under the project code ''NE'' as the first vehicle to be based on the E-GMP platform.{{cite web|author=Florent Ferrière|date=10 August 2020|title=Hyundai : Ioniq devient une marque, premier modèle en 2021|url=https://www.caradisiac.com/hyundai-ioniq-devient-une-marque-premier-modele-en-2021-184843.htm|publication-date=|access-date=15 September 2020|archive-date=24 September 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200924210726/https://www.caradisiac.com/hyundai-ioniq-devient-une-marque-premier-modele-en-2021-184843.htm|url-status=live}}{{cite web|last1=Evans|first1=Brett T.|title=Hyundai Teases Upcoming 2022 Ioniq 5 EV With Three Images|url=https://www.motor1.com/news/465808/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-teaser/d|access-date=15 January 2021|website=motor1.com|archive-date=9 October 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211009144028/https://www.motor1.com/news/465808/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-teaser/|url-status=live}} The dedicated electric vehicle platform enables the vehicle to adopt a fully flat interior floor with a 3-meter long wheelbase. The flat floor allows Hyundai engineers to develop a sliding front central console, which is able to slide backwards by {{cvt|140|mm|in|1}}. It has a cargo capacity of {{cvt|531|L|cuft|sigfig=3}} behind the rear seats that can be increased to nearly {{cvt|1600|L|cuft|sigfig=3}} with the second row seats folded. The rear legroom space was achieved by making the front seats approximately 30 percent thinner than typical seats.{{Cite web|title=Hyundai IONIQ 5 Revealed As Sleek, Stylish CUV: It's Not A Hatchback|url=https://insideevs.com/news/489883/hyundai-ioniq-5-cuv-debut-not-hatchback/|access-date=23 February 2021|website=InsideEVs|language=en|archive-date=23 February 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210223074826/https://insideevs.com/news/489883/hyundai-ioniq-5-cuv-debut-not-hatchback/|url-status=live}} The dashboard of the Ioniq 5 is made up of two {{cvt|12|in|mm}} screens, one for the instrument cluster display and the other for the infotainment system, both under one piece of glass. It is equipped with an optional [[head-up display]] with [[augmented reality]] support. Many of the interior parts are made from recycled materials, including [[PET bottles]]. The Ioniq 5 can be optioned with a single large glass panel roof without any support beams.{{Cite web|last=Beresford|first=Colin|date=23 February 2021|title=2022 Hyundai Ioniq 5 Kicks Off EV Lineup in Eye-Catching Style|url=https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a35590236/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-revealed/|access-date=23 February 2021|website=Car and Driver|language=en-US|archive-date=23 February 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210223070421/https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a35590236/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-revealed/|url-status=live}} The Ioniq 5 also features a front trunk, which has a {{cvt|57|L|cuft|sigfig=3}} capacity for the RWD version (except North America), while the AWD model and all North American versions have a {{cvt|24|L|cuft|sigfig=3}} capacity, due to the extra mechanical components underneath to support the front electric motor.{{Cite web|title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 revealed with impressive numbers, concept car looks|url=https://www.autoblog.com/2021/02/23/hyundai-ioniq-5-reveal/|access-date=23 February 2021|website=Autoblog|language=en|archive-date=23 February 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210223070611/https://www.autoblog.com/2021/02/23/hyundai-ioniq-5-reveal/|url-status=live}} It has the ability to charge electrical equipment through the built-in [[Vehicle-to-grid|V2L (Vehicle to Load)]] function. It can supply up to 3.6{{nbsp}}kW of power from the port mounted under the rear seats (except Australia) and from another port installed outside. The exterior port is able to supply power even if the vehicle is turned off. In some markets, the Ioniq 5 is offered with an optional Digital Side Mirror (DSM) which replaces the conventional side mirrors with cameras and [[OLED]] screens.{{Cite web |title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 Digital Side Mirror Works Just Fine: Test Drive |url=https://insideevs.com/reviews/510105/hyundai-ioniq5-digital-side-mirror/ |access-date=2022-09-19 |website=InsideEVs |language=en}} File:Hyundai Ioniq 5 Uniq-Paket – h 27062021.jpg|Rear view File:Hyundai Ioniq 5 IAA 2021 1X7A0217.jpg|Interior File:Hyundai 45 EV Concept at IAA 2019 IMG 0683.jpg|Hyundai 45 EV Concept (2019) == Powertrain == The vehicle is available with 58{{nbsp}}kWh or 72.6{{nbsp}}kWh battery capacity options, while the North American version will only be available with the 58{{nbsp}}kWh or 77.4{{nbsp}}kWh batteries. Every Ioniq 5 has a top speed of {{convert|185|km/h|mph|0|abbr=on}}.{{Cite web|title=2022 Ioniq 5 revealed: Retro-styled electric car leads a New Wave of EVs|url=https://www.greencarreports.com/news/1131361_2022-ioniq-5-revealed-retro-styled-electric-car-leads-a-new-wave-of-evs|access-date=23 February 2021|website=Green Car Reports|language=en|archive-date=23 February 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210223094136/https://www.greencarreports.com/news/1131361_2022-ioniq-5-revealed-retro-styled-electric-car-leads-a-new-wave-of-evs|url-status=live}} The battery can recharge {{convert|86|km|mi|abbr=on}} of range in 5 minutes, or from 10 to 80% in 18 minutes, or {{convert|375|km|mi|abbr=on}} in half an hour{{cite web |last1=Klingenberg |first1=Mathias |title=Hyundai Ioniq 5: Plutselig kan elbilen fylle energi om kapp med bensinbilen |url=https://www.tu.no/artikler/hyundai-ioniq-5-plutselig-kan-elbilen-fylle-energi-om-kapp-med-bensinbilen/511102 |website=Tu.no |publisher=[[Teknisk Ukeblad]] |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20210615170639/https://www.tu.no/artikler/hyundai-ioniq-5-plutselig-kan-elbilen-fylle-energi-om-kapp-med-bensinbilen/511102 |archive-date=15 June 2021 |language=no |date=15 June 2021 |url-status=live}} with its 800{{nbsp}}V charging capabilities by using a 350{{nbsp}}kW charger. The 800{{nbsp}}V [[Power inverter|inverter]] is sourced from Vitesco Technologies, a subsidiary of the [[Continental AG|Continental]] group.{{Cite web|last=Randall|first=Chris|date=24 March 2021|title=Vitesco to deliver 800-volt inverters for Hyundai's E-GMP|url=https://www.electrive.com/2021/03/24/vitesco-to-deliver-800-volt-inverters-for-hyundais-e-gmp/|access-date=8 April 2021|website=Electrive|language=en-us|archive-date=25 March 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210325031900/https://www.electrive.com/2021/03/24/vitesco-to-deliver-800-volt-inverters-for-hyundais-e-gmp/|url-status=live}} A five minutes charge will add {{cvt|100|km|mi|0}} to its range by [[WLTP (driving cycle)|WLTP]] standards.{{Cite web|last=Gitlin|first=Jonathan M.|date=23 February 2021|title=Here's the first of Hyundai's new 800-volt EVs—the Ioniq 5|url=https://arstechnica.com/cars/2021/02/this-crisp-looking-crossover-is-hyundais-next-ev-the-ioniq-5/|access-date=23 February 2021|website=Ars Technica|language=en-us|archive-date=23 February 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210223103405/https://arstechnica.com/cars/2021/02/this-crisp-looking-crossover-is-hyundais-next-ev-the-ioniq-5/|url-status=live}} {| class="wikitable collapsible" style="text-align:left; font-size:90%;" |+ Specifications{{Cite web|url=https://www.hyundai.com/kr/ko/e/vehicles/ioniq5/spec|title=제원|website=현대닷컴|access-date=27 April 2021|archive-date=27 April 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210427221046/https://www.hyundai.com/kr/ko/e/vehicles/ioniq5/spec|url-status=live}}{{Cite web|date=24 May 2021|title=Hyundai IONIQ 5 Electric CUV Disrupts EV Market with Ultra-Fast Charging and Vehicle-to-Load Power Capability|url=https://www.hyundainews.com/en-us/releases/3323|url-status=live|access-date=1 August 2021|website=Hyundai Newsroom|archive-date=25 May 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210525161021/https://www.hyundainews.com/en-us/releases/3323}}{{Citation|title=Vehicle Highlights {{!}} 2022 IONIQ 5 {{!}} Hyundai|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jLXA6cc7ens|language=en|access-date=1 August 2021|archive-date=1 August 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210801133517/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jLXA6cc7ens|url-status=live}}{{Cite web|title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 Gets Official EPA Range Rating: Up To 303 Miles|url=https://insideevs.com/news/552361/hyundai-ioniq5-epa-range-efficiency/|access-date=13 December 2021|website=InsideEVs|language=en}} !Battery !Layout !Power !Torque !{{cvt|0–100|km/h|mph|0}}
(official) !Range (claimed) !Top speed |- | rowspan="4" |58{{nbsp}}kWh
(Standard Range) | RWD | {{cvt|125|kW|PS hp|0}} | {{cvt|350|Nm|lbft|sigfig=3}} | 8.5{{Nbsp}}s | {{cvt|220|mi|km|0|order=flip}} (EPA)
{{cvt|384|km|mi|0}} (WLTP)
{{cvt|336|km|mi|0}} (Korea) | rowspan="12" |{{cvt|185|km/h|mph|0}} |- | rowspan=3 | AWD | {{cvt|53|kW|PS hp|0}} (front motor) | {{cvt|255|Nm|lbft|sigfig=3}} (F) | rowspan=3 | 6.1{{nbsp}}s | rowspan=3 | {{cvt|319|km|mi|0}} (Korea) |- | {{cvt|120|kW|PS hp|0}} (R) | {{cvt|350|Nm|lbft|sigfig=3}} (R) |- | {{cvt|173|kW|PS hp|0}} (combined) | {{cvt|605|Nm|lbft|sigfig=3}} (combined) |- | rowspan="4" |72.6{{nbsp}}kWh
(Long Range) | RWD | {{cvt|160|kW|PS hp|0}} | {{cvt|350|Nm|lbft|sigfig=3}} | 7.4{{nbsp}}s | {{cvt|451–481|km|mi|0}} (WLTP){{Cite web|last=Hawkins|first=Andrew J.|date=23 February 2021|title=Hyundai's electric Ioniq 5 crossover could be the ultimate camping companion|url=https://www.theverge.com/2021/2/23/22296991/hyundai-ioniq-5-electric-suv-ev-battery-range-specs|access-date=24 February 2021|website=The Verge|language=en|archive-date=24 February 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210224005912/https://www.theverge.com/2021/2/23/22296991/hyundai-ioniq-5-electric-suv-ev-battery-range-specs|url-status=live}}
{{cvt|401–429|km|mi|0}} (Korea) |- | rowspan=3 | AWD | {{cvt|70|kW|PS hp|0}} (front motor) | {{cvt|255|Nm|lbft|sigfig=3}} (F) | rowspan=3 | 5.2{{nbsp}}s | rowspan=3 | {{cvt|430–460|km|mi|0}} (WLTP)
{{cvt|370–390|km|mi|0}} (Korea) |- | {{cvt|155|kW|PS hp|0}} (R) | {{cvt|350|Nm|lbft|sigfig=3}} (R) |- | {{cvt|225|kW|PS hp|0}} (combined) | {{cvt|605|Nm|lbft|sigfig=3}} (combined) |- | rowspan="4" |77.4{{nbsp}}kWh
(Extra Long Range) | RWD | {{cvt|168|kW|PS hp|0}} | {{cvt|258|lbft|disp=flip}} | 7.3{{Nbsp}}s | {{cvt|303|mi|km|0|order=flip}} (EPA) |- | rowspan=3 | AWD | {{cvt|74|kW|PS hp|0}} (front motor) | {{cvt|255|Nm|lbft|sigfig=3}} (F) | rowspan=3 | 5.1{{Nbsp}}s | rowspan=3 | {{cvt|256|mi|km|0|order=flip}} (EPA) |- | {{cvt|165|kW|PS hp|0}} (R) | {{cvt|350|Nm|lbft|sigfig=3}} (R) |- | {{cvt|239|kW|PS hp|0}} (combined) | {{cvt|605|Nm|lbft|sigfig=3}} (combined) |} == Markets == === United States === The Ioniq 5 was released in the U.S. in May 2021, and went on sale in December 2021 as a 2022 year model.{{Cite web |last=Gauthier |first=Michael |date=2021-12-13 |title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 Offers 220 Miles Of Range For $39,700 While 303 Mile Variant Will Set You Back $43,650 |url=https://www.carscoops.com/2021/12/hyundai-ioniq-5-offers-220-miles-of-range-for-39700-while-303-mile-variant-will-set-you-back-43650/ |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=Carscoops}} The initial model year is equipped with a 77.4 kWh battery. The entry-level models are powered by a rear-mounted single motor producing {{cvt|168|kW|PS hp|0}}, while the more powerful models are available as a dual-motor version with AWD and {{cvt|239|kW|PS hp|0}} power output.{{Cite web |last=Karkafiris |first=Michael |date=2021-05-24 |title=America’s 2022 Hyundai Ioniq 5 Detailed, Here’s Everything You Need To See And Know |url=https://www.carscoops.com/2021/05/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-revealed-for-us-market-with-up-to-320-hp-and-up-to-300-miles-of-range/ |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=Carscoops}} A Standard Range model with a 58 kWh battery and a power output of {{cvt|125|kW|PS hp|0}} was released in spring 2022. Specific to the American and Canadian Ioniq 5, the vehicle is equipped a marker inside the headlamps, and tail lamps that blink completely as turn indicators.{{Cite web |date=2022-12-09 |title=2023 Hyundai Ioniq 5: Everything we know in Dec 2022 |url=https://topelectricsuv.com/news/hyundai/hyundai-ioniq-5-details-pre-orders/ |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=topelectricsuv.com |language=en-US}} === Europe === Initial models of the Ioniq 5 in Europe was offered with a choice of two battery packs (58 kWh and 72.6 kWh), three power outputs and either rear or four-wheel drive.{{Cite web |title=New 2021 Hyundai Ioniq 5: UK prices and specs confirmed |url=https://www.autoexpress.co.uk/hyundai/107696/new-2021-hyundai-ioniq-5-uk-prices-and-specs-confirmed |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=Auto Express |language=en}} During its introduction, a limited edition called the Project 45 was available, and only 3,000 units were made.{{Cite web |last=George |first=Jeo |date=2022-02-03 |title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 Project 45 edition gets 3X expected response [Update] |url=https://electricvehicleweb.com/hyundai-ioniq-5-uk/ |access-date=2023-01-12 |language=en-US}} In April 2022, the Ioniq 5 received a larger battery for the European market. The previous 72.6 kWh battery was replaced with a 77.4 kWh battery with an increased power output by {{cvt|8|kW|PS hp|0}} to {{cvt|168|kW|PS hp|0}}, while the entry-level 58 kWh battery option remains. Optional Digital Centre Mirror (DCM) and Digital Side Mirrors (DSM) also became available.{{Cite web |title=2023 Hyundai Ioniq 5 Gets Larger 77.4 kWh Battery In Europe |url=https://www.motor1.com/news/581860/2023-hyundai-ioniq-5-update/ |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=Motor1.com |language=en}}{{Cite web |title=Europe: 2023 Hyundai Ioniq 5 Enhancements Announced |url=https://insideevs.com/news/566583/europe-2023-hyundai-ioniq5-enhancements/ |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=InsideEVs |language=en}} === Indonesia === The Ioniq 5 was introduced in Indonesia in March 2022, and went on sale in April 2022.{{Cite web |date=2022-04-01 |title=Hyundai Introduces Ioniq 5 Electric Car Made in Indonesia |url=https://www.theindonesia.id/news/2022/04/01/100000/hyundai-introduces-ioniq-5-electric-car-made-in-indonesia |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=theindonesia.id |language=english}} It is assembled in the country at Hyundai's plant in [[Cikarang|Cikarang, West Java]] with a targeted annual production of 1,500 units.{{Cite web |date=2022-03-17 |title=Hyundai opens EV factory in Indonesia – RM6.5 billion plant to build Ioniq 5, 250,000 unit production capacity - paultan.org |url=https://paultan.org/2022/03/17/hyundai-opens-ev-factory-in-indonesia-cikarang-plant-to-build-ioniq-5-250000-unit-production-capacity/ |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=Paul Tan's Automotive News |language=en-US}}{{Cite web |last=최경애 |date=2022-05-01 |title=(LEAD) Orders for Hyundai's IONIQ 5 soar in Indonesia |url=https://en.yna.co.kr/view/AEN20220501001551320 |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=Yonhap News Agency |language=en}}{{Cite web |last=Indonesia |first=C. N. N. |title=Hyundai Tambah Produksi Ioniq 5 di Indonesia Tahun Depan |url=https://www.cnnindonesia.com/otomotif/20221115111900-603-873875/hyundai-tambah-produksi-ioniq-5-di-indonesia-tahun-depan |access-date=2023-04-17 |website=otomotif |language=id-ID}} Since April 2023, Hyundai increased the production rate from around 137 units to 1,000 units per month due to extremely high demand.{{Cite web |last=Indonesia |first=C. N. N. |title=Pangkas Inden, Hyundai Tambah Pasokan Ioniq 5 Jadi 1.000 Unit Sebulan |url=https://www.cnnindonesia.com/otomotif/20230417150356-603-938839/pangkas-inden-hyundai-tambah-pasokan-ioniq-5-jadi-1000-unit-sebulan |access-date=2023-04-17 |website=otomotif |language=id-ID}} === Singapore === The Ioniq 5 was released in Singapore in January 2023. Assembled in the country at the [[List of Hyundai Motor Company manufacturing facilities#Hyundai Motor Group Innovation Center in Singapore|Hyundai Motor Group Innovation Centre]] facility, it is the first vehicle assembled in Singapore in more than 40 years. The plant will initially import the vehicle's fully painted body shell from the Indonesian plant, while other parts are imported from South Korea. The first 100 units are designated as the "First 100" limited edition, with "First 100" badging, "First 100" debossing on the seats, and commemorative number plates.{{Cite web |last=Tan |first=Christopher |date=2023-01-11 |title=Hyundai to roll out first S’pore-assembled cars in first half of 2023 {{!}} The Straits Times |url=https://www.straitstimes.com/singapore/transport/hyundai-to-roll-out-first-s-pore-assembled-cars-in-first-half-of-2023 |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=www.straitstimes.com |language=en}}{{Cite web |date=2023-01-11 |title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 locally assembled in Singapore - CKD units of First 100 edition to get special Merlion badges - paultan.org |url=https://paultan.org/2023/01/11/hyundai-ioniq-5-locally-assembled-in-singapore-ckd-units-of-first-100-edition-to-get-special-merlion-badges/ |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=Paul Tan's Automotive News |language=en-US}} === India === The Ioniq 5 was introduced in India in January 2023 at the [[Auto Expo]]. It is Hyundai’s second electric offering for India after the [[Hyundai Kona Electric|Kona Electric]], which was available in the country since 2019. Assembled in the country, the Indian model is solely powered by a 72.6 kWh battery with {{cvt|160|kW|PS hp|0}} and rear-wheel drive.{{Cite web |title=Auto Expo 2023: Hyundai Ioniq 5 EV launched at Rs 44.95 lakh |url=https://www.autocarindia.com/car-news/auto-expo-2023-hyundai-ioniq-5-ev-launched-at-rs-4495-lakh-426904 |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=Autocar India}} == Concepts and prototypes == === Robotaxi === The Ioniq 5 [[Robotaxi]] was unveiled on 31 August 2021 and displayed at IAA Mobility 2021 on 6 September 2021.{{Cite news |title=Hyundai's joint venture unveils basic design of robotaxi based on IONIQ 5 |work=Aju Business Daily |url=https://www.ajudaily.com/view/20210901090352760 |access-date=1 September 2021}}{{Cite news |title=Motional To Launch Driverless Robotaxis in Las Vegas in 2023 |work=Forbes |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/samabuelsamid/2021/11/09/motional-to-launch-driverless-robotaxis-in-las-vegas-in-2023/?sh=1b1aa054714e |access-date=9 November 2021}} Lyft began offering transport by driver-less Ioniq 5 Robotaxis on the Las Vegas Strip on 16 August 2022.{{Cite web |date=16 August 2022 |title=Lyft offering driverless robotaxis on the Las Vegas Strip |url=https://www.8newsnow.com/news/local-news/lyft-offering-driverless-robotaxis-on-the-las-vegas-strip/ |access-date=22 August 2022 |publisher=KLAS |language=en-US}} The Ioniq 5 Robotaxi will have a human driver present until the end of 2022, after which the cars will operate on their own. File:Hyundai Ioniq 5 Robotaxi IAA 2021 1X7A0002.jpg|Robotaxi File:Hyundai Ioniq 5 Robotaxi IAA 2021 1X7A0317.jpg|Rear view === Ioniq 5 with e-Corner === A modified version of the Ioniq 5 was showcased by [[Hyundai Mobis]] at the [[Consumer Electronics Show#2023|56th Consumer Electronics Show]] in [[Las Vegas]] in January 2023. The vehicle is equipped with an "e-Corner" system which allows it to perform a crab walk, tank turn, diagonal driving and pivot turn. It features an in-wheel motor design that also integrates brake and steer by wire technology as well as an electric damper into a single package. Each wheel can accelerate, brake and steer independently.{{Cite web |title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 With e-Corner Modules Can Rotate Its Wheels 90 Degrees |url=https://insideevs.com/news/630245/hyundai-ioniq5-crab-walk-360-degrees/ |access-date=2023-01-12 |website=InsideEVs |language=en}} == Sales == {| class="wikitable" |- !
